Investment marketing
From: Aparupa Chakravarti >
Date: Monday, July 29, 2019 at 2:13 PM
To: Isaac Fokuo Jr >
Cc: Philip Lucky >, Emmanuel Hategeka >
Subject: Re: Mistui - Travel to Rwanda

Dear Philip,

Following up on Isaac's message, the team from Mitsui hopes to travel to Rwanda towards the end of next week (the week of August 5th) to explore both investment and trading opportunities. Tentatively, they would like to spend 2 days in the country to familiarize themselves with Rwanda in general (especially understanding government priorities), as well as specific sectors that they have expressed interest in. On the investment side, the areas that they would like to explore are as follows:
Transportation - they are particularly keen to understand the current status of the SGR project and where they could potentially plug into. They have reached out to MININFRA and are in touch with a senior engineer working on the SGR project, but if there are others you believe they should be in communication with, we would appreciate it if you could help set up those meetings.
ICT, especially digital infrastructure. They are keen to understand what opportunities there may be in KIC with regard to this, in addition to other available opportunities.
Energy - geothermal energy, but more so distributed energy, focusing on solar and LPG
Based on this information, if you think there are other organizations that the Mitsui team should meet with - in addition to the ones that Isaac mentioned - whilst they are in Rwanda, we would be grateful for those additions.

I'd be happy to speak on the phone to align on next steps, since I realize we are working on a fairly tight timeline.

Thank you and I look forward to your response.

Regards,
Aparupa

On Mon, 29 Jul 2019 at 14:50, Isaac Fokuo Jr > wrote:
Hello Philip,

Trust you are well. Mitsui is planning a trip to Rwanda next week to explore potential investment opportunities. They are interested in a couple of spaces including, ICT, Transportation, Energy, etc... and we will be grateful if you can set up meetings with the following entities:

Kigali Innovation City
RDB
ICT Ministry
Rwanda Information Society Authority
Rwanda Transportation Development Ministry

My colleague Aparupa will send you a follow-up email with more details and then we take it from there.

Thank you.

Isaac.

>         some recent updates about the preparations to launch the

From: ntabareshya alber  
Sent: Monday, August 12, 2019 7:15 PM
To: typo3support@risa.gov.rw; Elisabeth Uwamahoro ; Lucie Uwizeye 
Cc: executive@karongi.gov.rw
Subject: Ikibazo cya Website y'Akarere ka Karongi

 

Dear Lucie,

 

Muraho ?

 

Nk'uko nakomeje kubyifuza ko mwampa support ku kibazo cyabaye kuri TEMPLATE ya Website yacu y'Akarere ka Karongi, nongeye kubasaba nanone umunsi mwazaboneka mukamfasha gukora arrangement y'Amafoto na Contacts Details by'Abakozi b'Akarere (Directors). Nk'uko mubyibuka nari nabitangiye bigezemo hagati habaho ikibazo bikajya biza bigerekeranye, naje naho mugerageza kureba ikibazo kibitera ntimwahita mukibona, mumbwira ko nitahira muzabireba hanyuma mwitonze ikibazo cyaba gihari. Nakomeje kubibutsa mukambwira ko muri very busy kandi koko nabonaga muba mufite n'abantu benshi.

 

Mwamfasha rero mukampa umunsi nkazaza icyo kibazo kirangira bigakorwa nk'uko ba Boss babyifuza.

 

Murakoze.

 

 

==================================================

Niba imfatiro zishenywe, Umukiranutsi yakora iki? (Zab. 11,3). kandi Abah. 11,1.


NTABARESHYA Albert Jess
KARONGI DISTRICT 
NETWORK AND SYSTEM ADMINISTRATOR
MOB 0788534669
Email : ictkarongidistrict@yahoo.com

Said Rutabayiro Ngoga, PhD
Division Manager Technology Innovation

Begin forwarded message:

From: "Antoine Sebera"
Subject: RE: Questions related to the Demo from Swift Xi
Date: August 15, 2019 at 12:54:24 GMT+2
To: "'Emile Kinuma'"
Cc: "'Ben Rwamucyo'" ,

Dear Emile,

Sorry about the late reply. We have not yet secured a meeting with all the key stakeholders to discuss about the project. However, we would like to meet with you to discuss about your proposal so that it can include the recommendations made during the last meeting with the Hon. Minister.

Let me know of your availability on Tuesday or Wednesday next week.

Regards,

Antoine Sebera
Government Chief Innovation Officer
Email: antoine.sebera@risa.rw
Mob: (+250)788306461
Web: www.risa.rw

From: Emile Kinuma >
Sent: Wednesday, August 7, 2019 1:44 PM
To: antoine sebera >
Subject: Re: Questions related to the Demo from Swift Xi

Hi Antoine,

I trust this email finds you well.

This is a polite request for an update on the documents I shared with you.

Please let me know if you require any further information.

Thank you,
Emile

Le mar. 16 juil. 2019 à 19:00, Emile Kinuma > a écrit :

Good evening Antoine,

As we discussed earlier today I am sending you a video that shows some the capabilities of the Swift-Xi drone:

https://drive.google.com/open?id=1ySn2nbBT0nhFW1srh1u1zB89jolXVk-z

I have also taken the liberty of attaching the presentations with various relevant use cases I had shared previously for your review.

Please do not hesitate to contact me if you have any questions or require any additional information.

Thank you,
Emile

De : Emile Kinuma >

Hi Alex,

The updated presentation was well received and shared with the members of this email thread.

Victor and Ben,

Will the new document that was shared be enough to engage the relevant stakeholders? Kindly share the areas where you require additional information to help Nick and Alex address these specific points accordingly.

Thank you,
Emile

Virus-free. www.avast.com

Le lun. 24 juin 2019 à 07:41, Alex Echeverria > a écrit :

Hi Emile,
The presentation sent by Nick we put together during my stay here in Japan. This is a good place to start.
To go any further we will need a more detailed use case and requirements document.

Nick will be in Rwanda on 10 July until I believe the 16th. I think at this time it would be very beneficial to firm up the relationship and the way forward with an MOU or something along those lines.

You can provide Nick with a detail requirement document and clear understanding of the use case. There is much we can do with our UAVs and drones but we cannot start on everything at the same time. I would suggest we pick two (maybe three) use cases and we start with those.

The program will grow from there!

I believe there is an African conference here in Japan taking place the end of August; schedule permitting, I intend on attending this conference.

Best Regards,
Alex

From: Emile Kinuma >
Sent: Friday, June 21, 2019 3:00 AM
To: Ben Rwamucyo >
Cc: Victor Muvunyi >; Victor Kinuma >; amunezero@minict.gov.rw ; gkalema@minict.gov.rw ; saidngoga.rutabayiro@risa.gov.rw ; antoine sebera >; Dr Nick Barua. SWIFT-Xi >; Alex Echeverria >
Subject: Re: Questions related to the Demo from Swift Xi

Hi Ben,

While my colleagues from Switf-Xi continue to work on the proposal, I want to share with you the latest presentation of Swift Xi which includes even more case studies for you review.

Thank you,
Emile

Le jeu. 13 juin 2019 à 09:27, Emile Kinuma > a écrit :

Good Morning Ben,

This information has been well received and I have included the Swift Xi team to this email to ease communication and address the points you raised.

Nick, Alex,

Ben has given a brief description of what they expect. Kindly respond and indicate if you require additional information.

Thank you,
Emile

Virus-free. www.avast.com

Le jeu. 13 juin 2019 à 08:19, Ben Rwamucyo > a écrit :

Hello Emile,

I believe this finds you well.
We had the opportunity to meet the Hon. Minister Mrs. Paula yesterday and one of the items on the agenda was SWIFT Xi.

In that regard, after briefing her on the discussions and requests made on both sides, Hon. Minister suggested a simpler roadmap we can use as follows:

  •      Swift Xi makes a proposal defining

§ the kind of solutions they can provide

§ benefits

§ highlight the technologies to be used to provide the solutions

§ (and other ….)

  •      Hon. Minister will reach out to MoD presenting the proposal

  •      MoD will respond to the proposal accordingly 

  •      MoD, MINICT, RISA and Swift Xi will discuss a way forward.

Kindly, reach me at any time in case you have some follow up questions for clarification.

Regards,

Ben R

From: Emile Kinuma [mailto:emilekinuma@gmail.com ]
Sent: Tuesday, June 11, 2019 2:38 PM
To: Ben Rwamucyo >
Cc: Victor Muvunyi >; Victor Kinuma >
Subject: Re: Questions related to the Demo from Swift Xi

Hi Ben,

Thank you for the quick response. I look forward to your update.

Thanks,
Emile

Le mar. 11 juin 2019 à 14:19, Ben Rwamucyo > a écrit :

Hello Emile,

I did share the info with the team. We just haven’t yet had the chance to make a follow up meeting yet due to a busy week both at RISA and MINICT. Let me get back to you tomorrow in the afternoon.

Regards,

Ben R.

Get Outlook for iOS

On Tue, Jun 11, 2019 at 2:12 PM +0200, "Emile Kinuma" > wrote:

Good afternoon Ben,

Have you been able to circulate the questions I shared with you so that I can advise my partners?

Thank you,
Emile

Le ven. 7 juin 2019 à 15:27, Emile Kinuma > a écrit :

Hi Ben,

I shared with the team your request to have a demo. They are preparing their response in the meantime the have a few questions regarding the demo:

  1. Can you please give me an idea of the launch site and how many different places are they launching from?
  2. Are these sites in secure bases?
  3. What is the size of the area they want to cover?
  4. Are they looking for 24 hr/7 days per week surveillance
  5. Are they looking for the establishment of an operations center?

I am at your disposal for further information.

Thank you,
Emile

Julien Endelea Rujanju

Blockchain Development Specialist

PO. Box 6603 Kigali, Rwanda.

Mob: +250788893652

Email:   julien.rujanju@risa.gov.rw

www.risa.gov.rw

 

 

From: Kristy Anderson  
Sent: Friday, August 16, 2019 1:07 AM
To: Grace Nishimwe ; Grace Nishimwe - Work ; Athanase.Akumuntu@rlma.rw; Alexis.Rutagengwa@rlma.rw; rosemary.butare@rura.rw; Antoine.Sebera@risa.gov.rw; saidngoga.rutabayiro@risa.gov.rw; julien.rujanju@risa.gov.rw; donata.uwamariabutere@risa.gov.rw; duwamalia@hotmail.com; bonaventure.karikumutima@risa.gov.rw; martinemunezero.habimana@risa.gov.rw; tuyclaude@gmail.com; christinemana@gmail.com; emmuku@yahoo.com; Pothin.Muvara@rlma.rw; muvap@yahoo.fr; muvara.pothin@gmail.com
Cc: Kristy Anderson ; Ailey Kaiser Hughes ; Kieran McGowan ; Thierry Hoza Ngoga 
Subject: Rwandan Paperless Registration Document - Version 0.6
Importance: High

 

Dear All,

 

It was such a pleasure to meet you all last month to work together to build a successful pilot for the Rwandan citizens.  I hope that you are all doing well since our last meeting.

 

Please find attached the latest iteration of the design document, Version 0.6, which has been updated to include the various pieces that were determined that we needed to include in the document.  There are a few sections that we need confirmation/information in order to complete those sections of the document.

 

Section 6.2 (Page 14): MLG requires confirmation of whether the fee will maintain at 30,000 RWF or whether this fee will be changed.  It can potentially be reduced by 5,000 (printing the title fee) or further, which will enable a higher adoption of the pilot process as the fee is more affordable to the Rwandan citizens.

 

Section 8.1 (Page 15): MLG requires confirmation whether a manual approval for the registry office will be necessary or not. If the Rwandan Government determines it is not necessary, then this section can be amended to confirm what the process will be for the registrar (approval via app in a similar manner to the Notary).

 

Section 9 (Page 16): MLG requires confirmation of the 5 sectors that could participate in the pilot. The intention is that we will start from a possible list of 5 locations that will be decreased to a singular location. If the Rwandan government has already identified the best sector to participate, than that can be included in the next iteration of the document and not the other 4 potential locations. Choosing the best location for the pilot will be based on the following criteria:

 

*         Size of sector

*         Population of sector

*         Active land market

*         Higher frequency of registered land transfers

*         Higher literacy

*         Higher internet usage

*         Higher smartphone/tablet usage

*         Skilled Irembo agents

 

Section 13 (Page 29): MLG requires confirmation of who will be signing the design document.  We need the following information to be added to the document so that all responsible agencies have been included for signature.  

 

*         Name

*         Title

*         Agency Name

 

Those names will then also be added to Section 12.3 under  the “For Sign Off” column.

 

Can you all please review and provide me with your comments by Friday 13th September 2019?  When sending me an edited document, please save the document to your computer and include your initials in the name of the document..  For example, “Rwanda Paperless Registration Design Document - Version  0.6_GN” and “Rwanda Paperless Registration Design Document - Version  0.6_AA”.

 

I look forward to hearing from you in the future and working together on this pilot.

 

Kind Regards, 

 

Kristy Anderson

Senior Project Manager

Cell: +1 415 722 2749 

Email:   kanderson@mediciland.com

 



 

  _____  


CONFIDENTIALITY NOTICE: This message is intended only for the use and review of the individual or entity to which it is addressed and may contain information that is privileged and confidential. If the reader of this message is not the intended recipient, or the employee or agent responsible for delivering the message solely to the intended recipient, you are hereby notified that any dissemination, distribution or copying of this communication is strictly prohibited. If you have received this communication in error, please notify sender immediately by telephone or return email. Thank you.

website backend

I would like to request for support to reactivate the SSL certificate of our
website backend  : www.rfl.gov.rw   backend. Before

not secured in backend . See the screenshot below. 

 



 

Thank you.

Regards,

BAYINGANA   Theobard

IT Specialist

Rwanda Forensic Laboratory

description.raw:
From: Grace Iraguha  
Sent: Thursday, August 29, 2019 4:57 PM
To: 'Elisabeth Ujeneza' 
Subject: RE: Status on the issue of old maps appearing on platforms and search engines

 

Dear Elisabeth,

As I told you yesterday, the CEO was asking me if we couldn’t have the available data uploaded on Google, and the same approach be applicable with ESRI.  

Following my discussions with RLMUA’s focal person in this task, there are minimum requirements that data have to meet in order to be published on their platform including data format and  field attribute format, otherwise they return the data. Below is the Google data requirements link.

https://support.google.com/mapcontentpartners/answer/144284?hl=en  &ref_topic=22146 

For the time being, given that this process should take a long time, the team that is working on it decided to correct first all geometry errors in polygon features (actually administrative boundaries only), and will continue with the rest of data sets after they submitted these ones. He told me that tomorrow is the last day for geometry correction.

As for ESRI’s, I tried to call their country Manager, but he didn’t pick the phone. But the last update form RMLUA is that ESRI Rwanda is not in the position to support us on this issue. They advised to contact directly ESRI USA.

That is the last update. I think you have to update the CEO.

 

Kind regards,

 

Grace  

From: Elisabeth Ujeneza  > 
Sent: Thursday, August 22, 2019 5:18 PM
To: Innocent Muhizi  >; Antoine Sebera  >
Cc: Grace  >
Subject: Status on the issue of old maps appearing on platforms and search engines

 

Dear CEO,

Following the issue of having old maps and non-interactive maps of the republic of Rwanda appearing on some online platforms and search engines, RISA, MINICT, RHA and RLMUA teamed up to address it.

 

The following is a list of the actions taken and their status

 


S/N

Action

Relevance

Responsible

Status


1.

 

Identification of the most visited websites (source: RICTA and OGS)

 

Know which sites can influence the search results

 

MINICT, RISA

 

Done


2.

 

Provision of the current up to date base-map and 

Web maps to be published as service/links with embedded maps

 

 

Having a trusted source of national base-map and web map as a service for public use 

 

RLMUA

 

Fine tuning the data sets

 


3.

 

Communication to public institutions for uploading the national Base-map or point to web service maps on their websites

 

by publishing the correct national base-map, this will increase chances for search results pointing on accurate maps.

 

OGS, RISA

 

Upon availability of the National Base-map


4.

 

Approaching private institutions to find out the requirements for publishing the national map or point to maps published as web services

 

by publishing the correct national base-map on them, this will increase chances for search results pointing on accurate maps.

 

RLMUA,RISA

 

Not done


5.

 

Customization of institution's specific maps

 

Institutions custom maps should base on current and accurate base map

 

RLMUA

 

Not done


6.

 

Contacting Google to inquire on the procedures for updating Administrative Geo-data in replacement of old ones

 

 

Having updated and accurate administrative Geo-Data

 

RLMUA, RISA

 

Done…Waiting for Google’s feedback


7.

 

Clean national data (Province, District, Sector and Road network)

 

 

Having updated and accurate administrative Geo-Data ready to share with google

 

RLMUA and concerned institutions

 

In progress


8.

 

Share National data with Google for upload

 

 

Having updated and accurate administrative Geo-Data uploaded on google

 

RLMUA

 

Not Done


9.

 

Technical assistance

 

Assistance to upload maps or links to web maps on websites

 

RISA

 

Upon request

 

 

Kind Regards,

Elisabeth
description.html:
From: Grace Iraguha
Sent: Thursday, August 29, 2019 4:57 PM
To: 'Elisabeth Ujeneza'
Subject: RE: Status on the issue of old maps appearing on platforms and search engines

Dear Elisabeth,

As I told you yesterday, the CEO was asking me if we couldn’t have the available data uploaded on Google, and the same approach be applicable with ESRI.

Following my discussions with RLMUA’s focal person in this task, there are minimum requirements that data have to meet in order to be published on their platform including data format and field attribute format, otherwise they return the data. Below is the Google data requirements link.

https://support.google.com/mapcontentpartners/answer/144284?hl=en &ref_topic=22146

For the time being, given that this process should take a long time, the team that is working on it decided to correct first all geometry errors in polygon features (actually administrative boundaries only), and will continue with the rest of data sets after they submitted these ones. He told me that tomorrow is the last day for geometry correction.

As for ESRI’s, I tried to call their country Manager, but he didn’t pick the phone. But the last update form RMLUA is that ESRI Rwanda is not in the position to support us on this issue. They advised to contact directly ESRI USA.

That is the last update. I think you have to update the CEO.

Kind regards,

Grace

To: saidngoga.rutabayiro@risa.gov.rw
Cc: Tiger Mov Support Team

Dear Said,

Good morning.
We, Tiger Mov delegation with 9 Japanese students who are interested in business in Rwanda, would like to visit RISA and to have a short lecture about ICT strategy in Rwanda.

The purpose of the visit if to understand socio-economic situation in Rwanda and find out the opportunity to contribute the African development. All of them are keen to contribute the region in various ways such as business, NGOs etc.
We hope the participants will deepen their understanding of Rwanda and find opportunity for the future collaboration through this program.
We also plan to visit and collaborate with 250 startups in this program.

I attached the document explaining about this program.

Here is a participants list
https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1507MlzAEdnrngjFJ9YJ8SlWSKGspCOeOwF_XL5I5OSY/edit?usp=sharing

From: Grace Iraguha  
Sent: Thursday, September 5, 2019 3:41 PM
To: 'Ntagwabira Lambert' 
Subject: RE: Request for support (map of cells coordinates)

 

Dear Lambert,

 

I received your request, but I cannot  ensure you to have the map finalized
tomorrow as you suggested. Because I am on a training and the data you sent
(Latitude and longitude) are in a format that has to be converted cell by
cell to the decimal degree format.

 

Kind regards

 

From: Ntagwabira Lambert  > 
Sent: Thursday, September 5, 2019 9:48 AM
To: grace.iraguha@risa.gov.rw  
Subject: Request for support (map of cells coordinates)

 

Dear Grace,

 

Can you support us and make a map of the coordinates attached.

Coordinates are for cells we visited in DAP/SAP assessment.

We would appreciate if we get it as early as possible because we have a
presentation tomorrow afternoon.

Attached is the table that will help you.

 

Thank you,

Lambert N

description.raw:
From: Seraphine Kayitaramirwa [mailto:skayitaramirwa@nexteinstein.org] 
Sent: Tuesday, September 3, 2019 4:15 PM
To: undisclosed-recipients:
Subject: Invitation to BD4D - IC Final Competition

 

Dear Sir or Madam,

On behalf of the African Institute for Mathematical Sciences – Next Einstein Initiative (AIMS - NEI), I am writing to invite you to the Big Data for Development Innovation Challenge (BD4D - IC) Final Competition.

As part of the Big Data for Development project, AIMS – NEI has developed an innovation programme and will be organising the BD4D-IC to provide emerging young African data scientists and innovators with an opportunity to solve identified key development challenges. The main objective of this innovative programme is to identify and support the implementation and scaling of innovative big data solutions that leverage new and non-traditional sources of data such as agriculture, financial, mobile, satellite, social media, supply chain and transactions among others.  

Kindly find enclosed herewith a concept note with a proposed event agenda for your reference. It would be a great honour for AIMS-NEI to have you at the BD4D-IC Final Competition on September 9th, 2019 from 09.00 to 15.00 at the Lemigo Hotel, Kigali.  

To RSVP, please click here  .

Regards,

 

Séraphine Kayitaramirwa

Project Coordinator - AIMS industry initiative (AIMS I2)

African Institute for Mathematical Sciences (AIMS) | AIMS Global Secretariat

The Next Einstein Initiative | www.nexteinstein.org  

Mobile: +250788619387| Skype: kayisera| Twitter: @AIMS_next 

District Gasabo, Secteur Kacyiru, Cellule Kamatamu Rue KG590 ST Kigali, Rwanda

South Africa | Senegal | Ghana | Cameroon | Tanzania | Rwanda | 

United Kingdom | Canada | Germany | Scandinavia

Follow AIMS on social media:

         

 

DISCLAIMER: The contents of this email and any attachments are confidential. They are intended for the named recipient(s) only. If you have received this email by mistake, please notify the sender immediately and you are herewith notified that the contents are legally privileged and that you do not have permission to disclose the contents to anyone, make copies thereof, retain or distribute or act upon it by any means, electronically, digitally or in print. The views expressed in this communication may be of a personal nature and not be representative of AIMS-NEI and/or any of its Centres or Initiatives.

From: Jean Claude NTIRENGANYA  
Sent: Friday, September 13, 2019 5:18 PM
To: kclarisse@gmail.com; Valens NIYONSENGA ; Platini Gatete ; Eugene Maridadi ; BIGIRIMANA Florent ; Desire Manzi ; THEOPHILE MUTAGANDA ; grace.iraguha@risa.gov.rw; jbntaganira@gmail.com; Jean Damascene Sindayigaya ; nyakulama@yahoo.com; esther.mutamba@gmail.com; nchoi@worldbank.org; godfrey.kabera@minecofin.gov.rw; marie.uwanyirigira@minecofin.gov.rw; ronald.nkusi@minecofin.gov.rw
Cc: Alexis Rutagengwa ; Alexis Rutagengwa ; florien.nteziryayo@environment.gov.rw; Boniface SERUSHAGO ; mmanyifika@environment.gov.rw; mukamanaesperance@gmail.com; Esperance.Mukamana@rlma.rw
Subject: Invitation to the Knowledge Sharing Program (KSP) Dissemination Workshop

 

Dear all,

 

This serves to invite you to the KSP Final Workshop on NSDI and Land Use Monitoring System in Rwanda, which will take place on September 18, 2019, from 02:00-05:00 PM at Ubumwe Grande Hotel, Kigali-Rwanda.

 

Your technical input will be considered in the Final KSP Report.

 

Kindly find the official letter, agenda and concept note attached below.

 

 

Best regards!

 

-- 

Jean Claude NTIRENGANYA

Spatial Data Infrastructure Specialist

Rwanda Land Management and Use Authority
